c74object.name: j.message_array
c74object.digest: Declare an array of input nodes in the Jamoma namespace
c74object.description: j.message_array declares an array of input nodes in a Jamoma model. It wraps j.message features enabling models to receive control datas that can be sent from other Jamoma nodes. The message value will not be stored as part of the state of the model.
c74object.discussion:
j.message is an access point to receive messages within a model. The message value can be updated immediately from parent patcher, or by easing over time. Common types of messages, such as frequency, can be controlled using several different units (e.g. Hz, midinote or midicent) interchangeably.
User interfaces can control messages remotely. Mappings enable one message to dynamically control the value of another message. Cues can send messages to models as well.
Additionally the message enables inter-application communication. The message is provided with a unique global OSC address, and messages can be declared on the network in order for other applications, such as i-score, to inspect and control models.

inlet.description: Index of the instance to send value to. (1 to max number of instance. * will send value to all instances)

outlet.description: Message's value. When format attribute is set to single (default) output will be the selected instance message's value. When format is set to array, output will be a list of all message's value.

objarg.name: name
objarg.description: Message nodes array name defined using a bracket-based syntaxe: my/message.[2]

method.digest: Increment the selected instance last received value by the amount defined by the @stepsize attribute
method.description: Increment the selected instance last received value by the amount defined by the @stepsize attribute

method.digest: Decrement the selected instance last received value by the amount defined by the @stepsize attribute
method.description: Decrement the selected instance last received value by the amount defined by the @stepsize attribute

method.name: address
method.digest: Define an array of messages in the namespace. Ex: 'address buffer.[5]/clear'
method.description: The address message followed by an osc name containing a number of instances placed in bracket declares an array of returns in the namespace. Ex: 'address buffer.[5]/clear'

method.name: array
method.digest: Dispatch a list of values to every instance of the messages
method.description: Dispatch a list of values to every instance of the messages

method.name: array/select
method.description: This message selects which j.message_array's instance to address

method.name: dec
method.digest: Decrement the value by the amount defined by the stepsize attribute
method.description: Decrement the selected instance last received value by the amount defined by the @stepsize attribute

method.name: inc
method.digest: Increment the value by the amount defined by the stepsize attribute
method.description: Increment the selected instance last received value by the amount defined by the @stepsize attribute

method.name: init
method.digest: Reset the selected j.message instance to its default value
method.description: Reset the selected j.message instance to its default value

attribute.name: clipmode
attribute.digest: Set how values exceeding range will be clipped
attribute.description: Set how values exceeding range will be clipped. Available clipmodes are none, low, high, both, wrap and fold.

attribute.name: dataspace
attribute.description: Dataspace used by the messages. This enables received values to be updated using several alternative units interchangeably, such as degree and radian for the angle dataspace. Available dataspaces are angle, color, distance, gain, none, orientation, position, speed, temperature and time. The default dataspace is none.

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: Description of what this input node receives. The description is used when auto-documenting models.

attribute.name: format
attribute.digest: Format of the values output: single or array
attribute.description: Format of the output values. When set to single (default), output will be the selected instance received value. When set to array, output will be a list of all instances received value.

enum.name: single
enum.digest: Output the selected instance messages value
enum.description: Output the selected instance messages value

enum.name: array
enum.digest: Output the all instances messages value as a list
enum.description: Output the all instances messages value as a list

attribute.name: ramp/drive
attribute.digest: Set the scheduler driving the ramp
attribute.description: Set the scheduler driving the ramp: none - no ramping permitted, max - using the Max scheduler, and system - using the system clock. In Max it is recommended to use max rather than system.

attribute.name: ramp/function
attribute.digest: Function to be used for ramping
attribute.description: Sets what easing function to use for ramping. A wide range of easing functions as well as windowing functions are available. Please refer to the help file for further details.

attribute.name: ramp/function/parameters
attribute.digest: Get list of configurable parameters for the current ramp function
attribute.description: Get list of configurable parameters for the current ramp function. Certain ramp functions as specified by the @ramp/function attribute have additional configurable parameters that can be changed dynamically to modify the shape of the ramping curve. The message ramp/function/parameters cause j.message_array to output a list of all such parameters from the rightmost outlet, prepended by the symbol ramp/function/parameters. Refer to the help file for j.ramp for an overview of what functions have additional configurable parameters.

attribute.name: range
attribute.description: The expected range of values for this message. Depending on @clipmode this might be a recommended or definitive range.

attribute.name: repetitions/filter
attribute.description: Set whether to filter out value repetitions (1) or not (0).

attribute.name: stepsize
attribute.digest: Step size when incrementing or decrementing the received value
attribute.description: Stepsize used when incrementing or decrementing the received value using one of the messages +, -, inc or dec.

attribute.name: tags
attribute.description: Tags associated with the returns. This helps documenting the messages, and is also useful when restricting namespace searches using j.namespace.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: Datatype of the messages (decimal, integer, boolean, string, array, generic)

enum.name: none
enum.description: Received value will be a bang

enum.name: generic
enum.digest: Define a value of any kind
enum.description: Received value will be of any kind (including lists combining integers, decimals and symbols)

enum.name: boolean
enum.description: Received value will be either 0 or 1

enum.name: integer
enum.description: received value will be an integer number (int). Other values get converted to integer

enum.name: decimal
enum.description: Received value will be a decimal number (float)

enum.name: array
enum.digest: Define an array of decimal (float) value
enum.description: Received value will be a list of decimal numbers (float)

enum.name: string
enum.description: Received value will be a string (symbol)
